title: Edinburgh/New Town
name: The Scottish National Portrait Gallery
directions: Just to the north of St Andrew Square
content: The World's first purpose-built portrait gallery really stands out on Queen Street due to being built from red sandstone, rather than the yellow sandstone used for almost every other building in the New Town. Holds portraits of Scots from down the ages, with new faces being added all the time. Re-opened in Dec 2011 after a 2 year refurbishment.
